content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is how you can define such function in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words) 
    new_words = [word for word in words if first(word) == uppercase(first(word))]
    return new_words
end
```
This code works by using a list comprehension to filter the input list of `words`. It keeps only those words where the first character is a capital letter. This is achieved with the condition `first(word) == uppercase(first(word))`, which checks if the lowercased version of the first character of the word equals its uppercase version, i.e., it is a capital letter.
